alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 11 at 3:25AM EST until March 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, mainly Saturday afternoon and night. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 1 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow, possibly mixed with rain within the Champlain Valley, will begin overspread the region this evening. All precipitation will transition to snow by sunrise on Saturday. Periods of heavy snow will be possible late Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon where snowfall rates in excess of 1 inch per hour will be possible. Snow will taper off Saturday evening and come to an end Sunday morning. Gusty northwest winds between 25 and 40 mph will develop Saturday afternoon and continue into the overnight hours. Blowing snow may develop and significantly reduce visibility across the region.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
